	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Equity instruments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Equity instruments issued by the Company are recorded at the proceeds received, net of direct issuance costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.11
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Offsetting financial instruments
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Financial assets and liabilities are offset and the
	net amount reported in the statement of financial position when there is a legally enforceable right to offset the recognised amounts and there is an intention to settle on a net basis or realise the asset and settle the liability simultaneously.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.12
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Provisions
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Provisions are recognised when the Company has a present obligation (legal
	or constructive) as a result of a past event, it is probable that the Company an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits will be required to settle the obligation and a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Information on contingent liabilities is disclosed in the notes to the financial statements, unless the possibility of an outflow of resources
	embodying economic benefits is remote.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.13
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Earnings per share
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s earnings per share (&#145;EPS&#146;) is
	determined based on the net loss attributable to the equity shareholders. Basic loss per share are computed using the weighted average number of shares outstanding during the year. Diluted loss per share is computed using the weighted average number
	of common and dilutive common equivalent shares if any outstanding during the year, except where the result would be anti-dilutive. The weighted average number of equity shares outstanding during the year are adjusted for event of bonus issue.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.14
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Borrowing costs
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Borrowing costs consist of interest and other costs that the Company
	incurs in connection with the borrowing of funds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General and specific borrowing costs directly attributable to the acquisition,
	construction or production of qualifying assets, which are assets that necessarily take a substantial period of time to get ready for their intended use or sale, are added to the cost of those assets, until such time as the assets are substantially
	ready for their intended use or sale.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The interest cost incurred for funding a qualifying asset during the construction period is
	capitalised based on actual investment in the asset at the average interest rate. All other borrowing costs are recognised in Income statement in the period in which they are incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.15
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Exceptional Items
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Exceptional items are disclosed separately in the financial
	statements where it is necessary to do so to provide further understanding of the financial performance of the Company. They are material items of income or expense that have been shown separately due to the significance of their nature or amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Critical accounting estimates
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company prepares its financial statements in
	accordance with IFRS as issued by the IASB, the application of which often requires judgments to be made by management when formulating the company&#146;s financial position and results. Under IFRS, the management of the company is required to adopt
	those accounting policies most appropriate to the company&#146;s circumstances for the purpose of presenting fairly the company&#146;s financial position, financial performance and cash flows.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-15
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D205441D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In determining and applying accounting policies, judgment is often required in respect of
	items where the choice of specific policy, accounting estimate or assumption to be followed could materially affect the reported results or net asset position of the company should it later be determined that a different choice would be more
	appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management considers the accounting estimates and assumptions discussed below to be its critical accounting estimates and,
	accordingly, provide an explanation of each below. The discussion below should also be read in conjunction with the company&#146;s disclosure of significant IFRS accounting policies which are provided in note 4 to the financial statements,
	&#147;Significant accounting policies&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management has discussed its critical accounting estimates and associated disclosures with
	the company&#146;s Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	a.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Impairment reviews
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	IFRS requires management to undertake an annual test for impairment
	of&nbsp;finite lived assets, to test for impairment if events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Impairment testing is an area involving management judgment, requiring assessment as to whether the carrying value of assets can be supported
	by the net present value of future cash flows derived from such assets using cash flow projections which have been discounted at an appropriate rate. In calculating the net present value of the future cash flows, certain assumptions are required to
	be made in respect of highly uncertain matters including management&#146;s expectations of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	growth in EBITDA, calculated as operating profit before depreciation and amortisation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	timing and quantum of future capital expenditure;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	long-term growth rates; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the selection of discount rates to reflect the risks involved.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	b.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Revenue recognition
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Arrangements with multiple deliverables
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In revenue arrangements including more than one deliverable, the arrangement considerations are assigned to one or more separate deliverables
	based on its relative fair values for revenue recognition purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Determining the fair value of each deliverable can require estimates
	due to the nature of the goods and services provided.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	c.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Taxation
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company is subject to income taxes in Indian jurisdictions. Significant
	judgments are required in determining the provision for income taxes. There are transactions and calculations for which the ultimate tax determination is uncertain; such determination being made by the relevant taxing authorities. The company
	recognises liabilities for anticipated tax audit issues based on estimates of whether additional taxes will be found to be due. Where the final tax outcome of these matters is different from the amounts that were initially recorded, such differences
	will impact the current and deferred income tax assets and liabilities in the period in which such determination is made. Where considered necessary estimates are developed by management based on external specialist advice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There are no other judgemental areas identified by management that could have a material effect on the provisions made at the reporting date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-16
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D205441D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Recognition of deferred tax assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The recognition of deferred tax assets is based upon whether it is more likely than not that sufficient and suitable taxable profits will be
	available in the future against which the reversal of temporary differences can be deducted. To determine the future taxable profits, reference is made to the latest available profit forecasts. Where the temporary differences are related to losses,
	relevant tax law is considered to determine the availability of the losses to offset against the future taxable profits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Recognition
	therefore involves judgement regarding the future financial performance of the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	d.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employee benefit
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The present value of the employment benefit obligations depends on a
	number of factors that are determined on an actuarial basis using a number of assumptions. The assumptions used in determining the net cost (income) for employment benefits include the discount rate. Any changes in these assumptions will have an
	effect on the carrying amount of employment benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Discount rate as determined by the actuary is the interest rate used to discount the
	defined benefit obligation and calculate the net interest recognised in profit or loss on the net defined benefit liability. In determining the appropriate discount rate, consideration is given to the interest rates of high-quality corporate bonds
	that are denominated in the currency in which the benefits are to be paid and that have terms of maturity approximating the terms of the related pension obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other key assumptions relevant to the defined employment benefit obligations are based in part on current market conditions. Additional
	disclosures concerning these obligations are provided in note 24 &amp; 25.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	e.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	License Fees
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There are transactions and calculations for which the ultimate license
	fees determination is uncertain; such determination being made by the relevant authorities. The company recognises liabilities based on estimates of whether additional fees will be found to be due. Where the final outcome of these matters is
	different from the amounts that were initially recorded, such differences will impact the income statement and liabilities in the period in which such determination is made.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There are no other judgemental areas identified by management that could have a material effect on the provisions made at the reporting date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	f.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Other intangible assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Estimation of useful life
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The useful life used to intangible assets relates to the expected future performance of the assets acquired and management&#146;s judgement of
	the period over which economic benefit will be derived from the asset. The basis for determining the useful life for the most significant categories of intangible assets is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Capitalised software
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	useful life is determined by management at the time the software is acquired and brought into use and is regularly reviewed for appropriateness. For computer software licenses, the useful life represents management&#146;s view of expected term over
	which the Company will receive benefits from the software, but not exceeding the license term. For unique software products controlled by the Company, the life is based on historical experience with similar products as well as anticipation of future
	events which may impact their life such as changes in technology. Historically changes in useful lives have not resulted in material changes to the Company&#146;s amortisation charge.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-17
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	g.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Property, plant and equipment
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Property, plant and equipment also represent a
	significant proportion of the asset base of the Company being 69 % as at March&nbsp;31 2016 (March 31, 2015: 61%) of the Company&#146;s total assets. Therefore the estimates and assumptions made to determine their carrying value and related
	depreciation are critical to the Company&#146;s financial position and performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Estimation of useful life
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The charge in respect of periodic depreciation is derived after determining an estimate of an asset&#146;s expected useful life and the
	expected residual value at the end of its life. Increasing an asset&#146;s expected life or its residual value would result in a reduced depreciation charge in the income statement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The useful lives and residual values of Company assets are determined by management at the time the asset is acquired and reviewed annually for
	appropriateness. The lives are based on historical experience with similar assets as well as anticipation of future events which may impact their life such as changes in technology.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Historically changes in useful lives and residual values have not resulted in material changes to the Company&#146;s depreciation charge.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	h.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Provisions and contingent liabilities
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company exercises judgement in measuring and
	recognizing provisions and the exposures to contingent liabilities related to pending litigation or other outstanding claims subject to negotiated settlement, mediation, arbitration or government regulation, as well as other contingent liabilities
	(see note 27). Judgement is necessary in assessing the likelihood that a pending claim will succeed, or a liability will arise, and to quantify the possible range of the financial settlement. Because of the inherent uncertainty in this evaluation
	process, actual losses may be different from the originally estimated provision.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Segment analysis
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company operates in a single business segment viz. Direct to Home
	services in India; accordingly there is no reportable business segment or geographical segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-18

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Deferred tax

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Deferred tax relates to the following:

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Factors affecting the tax charge in future years
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Factors that may affect the Company&#146;s future tax charge include the impact of corporate restructurings, the resolution of open issues,
	future planning opportunities, corporate acquisitions and disposals, the use of brought forward tax losses and changes in tax legislation and tax rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company is routinely subject to assessments by tax authorities in India. These are usually resolved through the Indian legal system. The
	Company considers each issue on its merits and, where appropriate, holds provisions in respect of the potential tax liability that may arise. However, the amount ultimately paid may differ materially from the amount accrued and could therefore
	affect the Company&#146;s overall profitability and cash flows in future periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	At March 31, 2016 the gross amount and expiry dates
	of losses available for carry forward are as follows:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Reconciliation of Effective Tax Rate
</B>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Basic&nbsp;Profit/(loss) per share is calculated by dividing the Profit/(loss) for the year attributable to
	ordinary equity holders of the Company by the weighted average number of ordinary shares&nbsp;outstanding&nbsp;during the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Diluted
	Profit/(loss) per share are calculated by dividing the Profit/(loss) attributable to ordinary equity holders of the Company&nbsp;by the weighted average number of ordinary shares outstanding during the year plus the weighted average number of
	ordinary shares that would be issued on conversion of all the dilutive potential ordinary shares into ordinary shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-22
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Amortisation of licences and other intangible assets is included within Depreciation and Amortisation on
	the income statement. All licences have been pledged as security against borrowings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The remaining amortisation period of licence as
	follows:
</P>

	&nbsp;

	2&nbsp;to&nbsp;3&nbsp;years
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	3&nbsp;to&nbsp;4&nbsp;years
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company takes on lease certain Computer Sofwares under non-cancellable finance lease agreements. The lease
	terms range between 2 and 5 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-24
</P>

	The management consider that the carrying amount of trade and other
	receivables approximates their fair value. The allowance for estimated irrecoverable amounts of trade debtors has been determined by reference to past default experience and information on specific balances outside trade terms and is calculated by
	reference to the present value of anticipated future proceeds.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Bank balances comprise cash held by the Company on a short-term basis with original maturity of three months or
	less. The carrying amount of cash and cash equivalents approximates their fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s exposure to credit, currency and
	interest rate risks relating to cash and cash equivalents, together with a sensitivity analysis, is detailed in note 29.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1) Term Loans from banks are secured by:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) First pari-passu charge by way of mortgage on the entire immovable assets, hypothecation of entire movable assets, both present and future.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) Assignment of contracts relating to transponder capacity, all government authorizations, license and insurance policies, if any, or a
	negative lien, if contracts are not assignable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) Charge on Escrow Accounts and Debt Service Reserve Account.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d) Guarantee of Corporate Promoters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e) Personal Guarantee of Mr. Venugopal N. Dhoot and Mr. Pradipkumar N. Dhoot.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2) A part of term loans are secured by first pari-passu charge on entire current assets of the Company,
	present and future.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3) A part of term loans from banks are further secured by corporate guarantee of one non promoter shareholder and
	also by Videocon Industries Limited.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4) Part of the term loans from Banks are also secured / guaranteed by:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) Pledge of 30% shares of the Company at the time of sanction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) Non-Disposal undertaking of 21% shares of the Company at the time of sanction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) Mortgage of various properties of group entities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5) The Company was in compliance with its financial covenant requirements of our loan agreements during fiscal year 2016. However, there were
	defaults in prior periods. Since the Company has not obtained a specific waiver from the lenders of their right to accelerate the repayment of entire loan amount by the reporting date, the loan amounts are classified as current liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-26
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10) The Loan from other parties are repayable on demand.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11) The rate of interest of loans from other parties is SBI PLR minus 2%

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Defined Benefit Plans &#150; Gratuity:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The plan provides for a lump sum payment to vested employees, at retirement, death while in employment or on termination of employment, of an
	amount equivalent to 15 days salary for each completed year of service or part thereof in excess of six months. Vesting occurs upon completion of five years of service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Defined benefit plans as per actuarial valuation &#150; Gratuity
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	For the years ended

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Defined Contribution Plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company makes Provident Fund contributions to defined contribution plan administered by the Regional Provident Fund Commissioner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under this scheme, the Company is required to contribute a specified percentage of payroll cost to fund the benefits. The Company has
	recognised Rs.&nbsp;43.42 million for Provident Fund contributions in the income statement for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 (March 31, 2015: Rs.&nbsp;37.77 million). The contributions payable by the Company are in accordance with rules framed
	by the Government of India from time to time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Defined benefit plans as per actuarial valuation &#150; Leave Encashment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Sub notes
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. DTH License fee payable by the Company is calculated on adjusted gross revenue in accordance with the judgment given by TDSAT in the
	petition No. 92(C) and 93 (C) of 2009 dated 28th May 2010 and the same is provided for in the books of account. The Company has received a demand notice dated March 24, 2014 from Ministry of Information &amp; Broadcasting demanding additional
	license fees of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;1,582.89 million (including interest of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;272.44 million) on the difference between gross revenue and adjusted gross revenue upto financial year 2012-13. The Company has filed a petition before TDSAT challenging the demand on, among
	others, the grounds of arbitrariness, non following principals of natural justice and during pendency of appeal before the Hon&#146;ble Supreme Court dealing with the issue of license fees to be paid by DTH operators etc. and an interim stay has
	been granted for the payment of this demand. As per the stand of Ministry of Information and Broadcasting there would be a claim for additional license fees for financial year 2013-14 to 2015-16 of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;3470.02 million. Pending the matter for further hearing and final outcome, no provision is considered necessary by the management.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2 (a). In respect of Entertainment Tax in various States, the Company has preferred appeals / writ petitions in the High Court / Supreme Court
	challenging the applicability of Entertainment Tax to the Company. Pending the final outcome of these appeals / petitions, the Company has paid under protest and provided for the disputed liability, except for the disputed amount of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;74.50 million (Previous Year
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;127.14 million) in respect of one state (Previous year two states).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2(b). Further, the company has received show cause notice (SCN) dated 29&nbsp;December, 2015 from the office of Commissioner of Entertainment
	Tax, Uttar Pradesh, asking the company to show cause as to why an additional demand of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;422.95 million together with interest of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;185.77 million upto 31st December, 2015 should not be raised on the company. The company has replied to the said SCN explaining the
	authority that amount in the notice is incorrect and the Company has paid the entertainment tax dues as per its working even though writ petition is pending. In the opinion of the management, no further liability is expected and no provision is
	considered necessary in this regard.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. The Company had received demand notices for non-deduction of income tax at source from certain
	payments and interest thereon for Assessment Year 2010-11, 2011-12 and 2012-13. The Company had filed appeals against the said orders and demand notices. The appeals for Assessment years 2010-11 and 2011-12 have been disposed off by the Commissioner
	of Income Tax (Appeals) who has granted substantial relief. Based on the decisions of the first appellate authority, the Assessing officer has revised the demand at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;12.70 million for the Assessment Year 2010-11,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;12.31 million for the
	Assessment Year 2011-12 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;74.41 million for Assessment year 2012-13. The Company has preferred appeal before the Appellate
	Tribunal for Assessment Year 2010-11 &amp; 2011-12. The Company has provided for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;1.81 million for the Assessment Year 2010-11,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;12.31 million for Assessment Year 2011-12 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	&nbsp;12.53 million for Assessment Year 2012-13 and no further provision is considered necessary by the management.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-31
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	29.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	Capital and financial risk management
<B>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	I.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Capital risk management
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s objectives when managing capital are to
	safeguard the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern in order to provide returns for shareholders and benefits for other stakeholders and to maintain an optimal capital structure to reduce the cost of capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s policy is to manage its borrowings using mixture of long-term and short-term borrowing facilities, including money market
	borrowings and other instruments permitted under its Treasury Policy, to meet anticipated funding requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The gearing ratio is
	calculated as net debt divided by total capital. Net debt is calculated as total borrowings (including &#145;current and non-current borrowings&#146; as shown in the Statement of financial position) less cash and cash equivalents. Total capital is
	calculated as &#145;equity&#146; as shown in the Statement of financial position plus net debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The gearing ratio at March 31, 2016 and
	March 31, 2015 were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Term deposits of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	5,282.23 million as at March 31, 2016 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3,112.45 million as at March 31, 2015 (including restricted cash as at March&nbsp;31, 2016:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3,282.23 million and as at March&nbsp;31, 2015:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#8377;
</FONT>
</FONT>
	3,110.71 million which are placed towards margin / reserves for term loans and bank guarantees) are shown under other financial assets
	and not included in cash &amp; cash equivalent for calculation of above gearing ratio.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	II.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Financial risk management
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s activities expose it to a variety of
	financial risks: market risk (including currency risk, fair value interest rate risk, cash flow interest rate risk and price risk), credit risk and liquidity risk. The Company&#146;s overall risk management programme focuses on the unpredictability
	of financial markets and seeks to minimise potential adverse effects on the Company&#146;s financial performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Risk management is
	carried out by a treasury department (company treasury) as per the policy of the Company. Company treasury identifies, evaluates and hedges financial risks if any in close co-operation with the company&#146;s operating units. The policy covers the
	areas of overall risk management, including foreign exchange risk, interest rate risk, credit risk, liquidity risk, use of derivative financial instruments and non-derivative financial instruments, and investment of excess liquidity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The major financial instruments of the Company include cash and bank deposits, trade and other receivables, trade and other payables and
	borrowings. Details of these financial instruments are disclosed in the respective notes to the financial statements. The risk management approach of the Company is aimed to minimize the financial risks for the business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-35
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage115"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<A HREF="#D205441D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Market Risk
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	(i)
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Foreign exchange risk
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company operates in local market and carries no major foreign
	currency risk, except for trade payables in respect of imports made by the company. However according to the management there is no material impact of the same. Trade payables in foreign currencies as on March 31, 2016 is INR 483 million (March 31,
	2015 INR 742 million). The impact of foreign exchange sensitivity of 5% strengthening or weakening on the payables is INR 24 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	sensitivity analysis is based on a reasonably possible change in the underlying foreign currency against the INR computed from historical data and assuming all other information to be constant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	(ii)
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Interest rate risk
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Interest rate risk can be either fair value interest rate risk or
	cash flow interest rate risk. The Company&#146;s interest rate risk arises from long-term borrowings. Borrowings issued at variable rates expose the Company to cash flow interest rate risk which is partially offset by cash held at variable rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In respect to borrowing on floating rates the Company negotiates exit options without break-costs on interest reset dates wherever
	possible.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The table below shows the Company&#146;s sensitivity to interest rates on floating rate bank borrowings on profit or loss and
	equity:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The profile of Company&#146;s borrowings as at March 31, 2016 and March 31, 2015 is provided on Note 22.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<I>
	(iii)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
	Price risk
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company is not exposed to any price risk as the Company does not
	have any investment as on the reporting date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Credit risk
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Credit risk encompasses the direct risk of default, the risk of
	deterioration of creditworthiness as well as concentration risks. It principally arises from deposits with banks and others, trade and other receivables mainly linked to the credit exposures of customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company maintains its Cash and cash equivalents, Derivative financial instruments, Bank deposits with banks and financial institutions
	having good reputation, good past track record and high quality credit rating and also reviews their credit-worthiness on an on-going basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Trade receivables of the Company are typically unsecured and are derived from revenue earned from customers. Credit risk is managed through
	credit approvals and periodic monitoring of the creditworthiness of customers to which Company grants credit terms in the normal course of business.&nbsp;The allowance for impairment of Trade receivables is created to the extent and as and when
	required, based upon the expected collectability of accounts receivables. The Company has no concentration of credit risk as the customer base is geographically distributed in India.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-36
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage116"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D205441D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Videocon d2h Limited &#150; Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(All amounts are in INR Million, unless otherwise stated)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Notes to Financial Statements for the year ended March 31, 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Liquidity risk
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Liquidity risk is the risk that the Company will not be able to meet its
	financial obligations as they become due. Company manages liquidity risk by maintaining adequate banking facilities and reserve borrowing facilities, by continuously monitoring forecast and actual cash flows and matching the maturity profiles of
	financial assets and liabilities. It also maintains varied maturity profile with a cap on the level of debt maturing in any one calendar quarter, therefore minimising refinancing risk. Long-term borrowings generally mature between one and 8 years.
	Liquidity is reviewed on a daily basis based on weekly cash flow forecast.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Excessive risk concentration
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Concentrations arise when a number of counterparties are engaged in similar business activities, or activities in the same geographical region,
	or have economic features that would cause their ability to meet contractual obligations to be similarly affected by changes in economic, political or other conditions. Concentrations indicate the relative sensitivity of the company&#146;s
	performance to developments affecting a particular industry. In order to avoid excessive concentrations of risk, the company&#146;s policies and procedures include specific guidelines to focus on the maintaining existing subscriber&#146;s base,
	adding new subscribers and developing innovative products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	30.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	Fair value of financial instruments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fair value hierarchy
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Financial liabilities measured at fair value and classified into level 3 :
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This level of hierarchy includes financial liabilities measured using inputs that are not based on observable market data (unobservable
	inputs). Fair values are determined in whole or in part, using a valuation model based on assumptions that are neither supported by prices from observable current market transactions in the same instrument nor they are based on available market
	data. The item in this category is employee stock option valuation, measured at fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT">
<FONT COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	INSAT-ST2/Ku/DTH/01/2015
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	August 2015
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Proprietary
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	AGREEMENT FOR THE PROVISION OF Ku-BAND SPACE SEGMENT CAPACITY IN THE INSAT-ST2
	SYSTEM
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	This Agreement No: INSAT-ST2 / Ku / DTH / 01 / 2015 is entered into on this 1st day of August, 2015 by and between
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	THE PRESIDENT OF INDIA
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	acting through and represented by the
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	SECRETARY, DEPARTMENT OF SPACE, GOVERNMENT OF INDIA, hereinafter referred to as &#147;DOS&#148; (which expression shall unless excluded by or repugnant to the context be deemed to
	include its successor and assigns) of the ONE PART
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	and,
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Videocon d2h Limited,
	erstwhile Bharat Business Channel Limited,
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	a company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	having its registered office at
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Auto Cars Compound, Adalat Road,
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Aurangabad-431005, Maharashtra
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	India;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	hereinafter referred to as &#147;CUSTOMER&#148; (which expression shall unless excluded by or repugnant to the context be deemed to include its successors in business and permitted
	assigns) of the OTHER PART;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	WITNESSES AS FOLLOWS:
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	I. WHEREAS, CUSTOMER has
	requested Satellite Communication and Navigation Programme Office (SCNP), under the Department of Space (DOS) for provision of Ku-band capacity for the purpose of meeting its DTH requirements;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	II. WHEREAS, SCNP / DOS has requested ANTRIX to explore the availability of such Ku band capacity in India from global vendors;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	III. WHEREAS, Antrix, vide its Public Tender Ref.: Antrix/PT/2012-13/01 dated 17-08-2012 had floated an RFP Ref.: Antx/Ku Band/64/2014-15 dated December 2014 to global vendors with
	the specific purpose of exploring and empaneling all probable transponder providers for a period of two years;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	ANTRIX CORPORATION LTD. BANGALORE
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	DEPARTMENT OF SPACE
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	GOVT. OF INDIA
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	VIDEOCON d2h LIMITED
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	MUMBAI

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Page 2 of 2
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage119"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/25/0001193125-16-656592_G205441EX42FPG003N.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT">
<FONT COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	INSAT-ST2/Ku/DTH/01/2015
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	August 2015
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Proprietary
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	IV. WHEREAS, Singtel, being one of the respondents to this RFP, had submitted the
	offer of Ku bandwidth on ST 2, at 88 deg E, for DTH services, with certain technical specifications;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	V. WHEREAS, the CUSTOMER, having sufficiently evaluated the
	technical specifications, has accepted the offer of Ku bandwidth on ST 2 at 88 deg E for its DTH services;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	VI. Accordingly, ANTRIX having procured such capacity
	from Singtel under an Agreement dated August 1, 2015 bearing No. INSAT(ST-2)-DTH-1B-2015 has provided such Ku band space segment to DOS, in order to provision the same to CUSTOMER;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	VII. WHEREAS, DOS, through ANTRIX having received the Ku band capacity in the ST2 satellite system from Singapore Telecommunications Limited, Singapore (herein after referred to as
	&#147;Singtel&#148;) under an Agreement dated August 1, 2015 bearing No. INSAT(ST-2)-DTH-1B-2015, in order to provide the same to CUSTOMER, has agreed to the request of CUSTOMER and has decided to make available to CUSTOMER, on a back to back
	provision basis, its space segment capacity in the ST2 satellite system (henceforth, called as INSAT-ST2 Satellite system) for such purpose under appropriate terms and conditions contained herein;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	WITNESSES AS FOLLOWS:
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of these promises and of the mutual
	promises and of the Parties contained herein, the Parties hereto agree to be bound unconditionally to the following terms and conditions:
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	ARTICLE 1. Definitions
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	As used in this Agreement:
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Antrix-Singtel Agreement&#148; means the
	Agreement dated August 01, 2015 bearing No. INSAT(ST-2)-DTH-1B-2015 entered into between Antrix Corporation Ltd. and Singapore Telecommunications Limited, Singapore for lease of Ku-Band Space Segment Capacity.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Capacity&#148; means the 540MHz (10 x 54MHz) clean, interference free and bare Ku-band transponder bandwidth, with transponder frequency management and Power Equivalent
	Bandwidth, to be provided on the K5A, K5B, K6A, K6B, K7A, K7B, K8A, K8B K9A and K9B of ST-2 Transponders.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	ANTRIX CORPORATION LTD. BANGALORE
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	DEPARTMENT OF SPACE
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">

	&#147;Commencement Date of Service&#148; subject to Article 2, in respect of the
	Capacity for ten (10) ST-2 Transponders; on the K6A, K7A, K8A, K9A, K8B and K9B, K6B, K7 B , K5 A and K5 B shall be from 01st August 2015.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Early Termination
	Charges&#148; means, in relation to Capacity that is cancelled (prior to the Commencement Date of Service) or terminated by the CUSTOMER prior to the end of the applicable Service Period(s), 100% of all fees and charges (monthly recurring or
	otherwise) for the balance of the Service Period(s).
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Payment Date&#148; means the Due date specified in this Agreement for payment of any sum payable by the
	CUSTOMER to DOS under this Agreement.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Power Equivalent Bandwidth&#148; means the amount of total power used by the carriers, being represented as a bandwidth
	equivalent. In a single 54MHz transponder transmission, the total PEB refers to the saturation power of the transponder.&#148;
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Service Charges&#148; means
	the recurring charges payable by the CUSTOMER in respect of the Capacity as per Exhibit B hereto.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Service Period&#148; means the period(s) for which the
	CUSTOMER must acquire Capacity on the respective Transponder, commencing from the Commencement Date of Service until 31st July 2018.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Serving Satellite&#148;
	means the satellite designated by Singtel to provide the Capacity, including the ST-2 Satellite or any satellite used in substitution or replacement of the same.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;ST-2 Satellite&#148; means the communications spacecraft designated as ST-2 and operated by Singtel at the 88&deg;E geostationary orbital location.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;ST-2 Transponders&#148; means the Transponders of 54MHz on the ST-2 Satellite as further described in Exhibit A.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Singtel shall mean &#147;Singapore Telecommunications Limited, Singapore, the satellite operator providing the transponder capacity on ST-2 satellite system.
	&#147;Transponder&#148; means any 54MHz Ku-band radio frequency transmission channels on the Serving Satellite through which Singtel shall provide the Capacity.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Successfully Operating Transponder&#148; means a transponder which is operational and fully meets and satisfies the technical specifications as per Exhibit
	&#150; A hereto.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT">
<FONT COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	INSAT-ST2/Ku/DTH/01/2015
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	August 2015
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	Proprietary
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&#147;Transponder Failure&#148; means, with respect to any Transponder, such
	Transponder fails to provide Capacity (or part thereof) that meets the technical specifications as per Exhibit A in any material respect for any period of three (3) consecutive days. For purposes of this definition, measurement of periods of failure
	shall commence when the signal has been vacated to permit verification of the existence of the failure by DOS/Singtel.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	ARTICLE 2. Transponder Capacity
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	a. In accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including all of its Exhibits (Exhibits A, B and C) which form part of this Agreement, DOS shall provide and the
	CUSTOMER shall take on lease the Capacity for the relevant Service Period for transmission purposes within India.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	b. CUSTOMER and DOS agree that the transponder
	capacity shall be utilized in accordance with this Agreement and its Exhibits.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	c. CUSTOMER and DOS agree that DOS make the Capacity available to CUSTOMER on a
	24-hour, seven-day-per-week basis, for a period of three years (3) from the commencement date of Service during the entire Service Period i.e., until 31st July 2018.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	d. CUSTOMER agrees and understands that the lease of the transponder capacity under this Agreement, shall be subject to the terms and conditions of the
	Antrix-Singtel Agreement dated August 1, 2015 (&#147;hereinafter referred to as &#147;Antrix-Singtel Agreement&#148;) and that DOS is leasing transponder capacity to the CUSTOMER after receiving the same from ANTRIX under the aforesaid Agreement.
	The CUSTOMER further agrees and understands that the obligations applicable to Antrix there under shall be applicable to the CUSTOMER herein mutatis mutandis, as the benefit under the Antrix-Singtel Agreement inures to the benefit of the CUSTOMER.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	ARTICLE 3. Interruption in the Provision of Capacity
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	a. For the purpose of
	this Article 3, an &#147;interruption&#148; means a loss in the availability of the Capacity (or any part thereof) as per the understanding given below.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	b. No
	allowances or credits will be made, for whatever reason, for any single interruption (including planned outages by DOS), in the availability of the Capacity, which is less than one (1) hour duration.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	ANTRIX CORPORATION LTD. BANGALORE
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:0.5PT" COLOR="#FFFFFF">
